b2bpl.translation
Class Translator

java.lang.Object
  b2bpl.translation.CodeGenerator
      b2bpl.translation.Translator
All Implemented Interfaces:
TranslationConstants
public class Translator
extends CodeGenerator
implements TranslationConstants

The main entry point to the translation of a set of bytecode classes to a BoogiePL program.

Some aspects of the translation process can be configured by passing an appropriate Project instance containing the desired translation settings upon creating the Translator. In particular, the following aspects of the translation can be configured:

  • The verification methodology for object invariants (see Project.isThisInvariantsOnly()).
  • Whether to explicitly model runtime exceptions instead of ruling them out by verification conditions (see Project.isModelRuntimeExceptions()).
  • The maximal magnitude of integer constants to represent explicitly in the BoogiePL program (see Project.getMaxIntConstant()).

The Translator is immediately responsible for generating the following parts of the resulting BoogiePL program:

  • The core part of the background theory which is the same for every translation. This mainly includes the heap and core type system axiomatization (array subtyping, value type ranges, ...).
  • The global axiomatization which depends on the concrete bytecode classes being translated. As an example, every type referenced in a class will trigger the declaration of a constant representing the type as well as the generation of a set of axioms defining the type's supertype hierarchy as well as other properties such as whether the type is final or not. References to fields and special constants (such as strings) also lead to a set of global declarations being generated.
The following parts of a bytecode class are not directly translated by this class but their translation is instead delegated to other classes:
  • The actual BML specifications which appear in the global section of the resulting BoogiePL program (in particular type specifications such as invariants) are translated by a SpecificationTranslator.
  • The individual methods are translated by a MethodTranslator which maps every bytecode method to a single BoogiePL procedure.
Since BML specifications and bytecode methods may contain type references and other references which may require global axioms to be generated, the Translator passes a TranslationContext to every SpecificationTranslator and MethodTranslator which should be used to translate those references.

Author:
Ovidio Mallo
See Also:
Project.isThisInvariantsOnly(), Project.isModelRuntimeExceptions(), Project.getMaxIntConstant(), SpecificationTranslator, MethodTranslator, TranslationContext

Field Detail

project

private final Project project
The project containing the settings of the translation.

context

private Translator.Context context
The TranslationContext responsible for resolving special references (type/field/string/... references) encountered in the bytecode classes being translated. This context is passed to all SpecificationTranslators and MethodTranslators to which part of the translation is delegated.

declarations

private java.util.List<BPLDeclaration> declarations
The set of declarations generated during the translation of the given bytecode classes. These make up the resulting BoogiePL program.

valueTypes

private static final JBaseType[] valueTypes
The set of value types explicitly supported by the translation.

Constructor Detail

Translator

public Translator(Project project)
Creates a new translator which is configured by the given project. Once a translator has been created, it can be used to translate different bytecode classes under the same configuration (given by the here provided project).

Parameters:
project - The project containing the configurations of the translation.
See Also:
translate(JClassType[])

getSymbolicIntLiteralName

private java.lang.String getSymbolicIntLiteralName(int literal)
Returns the name of a BoogiePL constant representing the given literal. This method is used for integer values which are abstractly represented by constants since their magnitude is considered to be too large to be handled by theorem provers.

Parameters:
literal - The value for which to build the constant name.
Returns:
The name of the constant representing the given literal.

Axiomatizes some aspects of the JVM type system.

axiomatizeHelperFunctions

private void axiomatizeHelperFunctions()
Defines and axiomatizes some simple helper functions.

flushPendingTheory

private void flushPendingTheory()
Method in which all the pending background theory for which information has been collected during the actual translation of the bytecode methods can be added to the BoogiePL program. This method is thought for those parts of the background theory which can only be generated once all the bytecode methods have been translated. Therefore, it should be invoked right before assembling the BoogiePL program after the translation of all bytecode methods.

addInvariantDeclaration

private void addInvariantDeclaration(JClassType type)
Adds an axiom representing the type's object invariant.

Parameters:
type - The class type whose object invariant should be translated.
